info.description:
<dmsdk/dlib/array.h>

Templatized array with bounds checking.
template <typename T> class dmArray

The backing storage is either auto-allocated (dynamically allocated) or user-allocated (supplied by user). With exception of changing the size and capacity, all operations are guaranteed to be O(1).

dmArray<int> a;
a.Push(1);
info.name: Array

elements.description: Last element of the array

returnvalues.doc: T& reference to the last element
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::Back

elements.description: Last element of the array (const)

returnvalues.doc: const T& const-reference to the last element
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::Back

elements.description: Pointer to the start of the backing storage

returnvalues.doc: T* pointer to start of memory
returnvalues.name: pointer

elements.name: dmArray::Begin

elements.description: Capacity is currently allocated storage.
elements.name: dmArray::Capacity

elements.description: Check if the array is empty. The array is empty when the size is zero.

returnvalues.doc: boolean true if the array is empty
returnvalues.name: boolean

elements.name: dmArray::Empty

elements.description: Pointer to the end of the backing storage The end is essentially outside of the used storage.

returnvalues.doc: T* pointer to end of memory
returnvalues.name: pointer

elements.name: dmArray::End

elements.description: Remove the element at the specified index. The removed element is replaced by the element at the end (if any), thus potentially altering the order. While operation changes the array size, it is guaranteed to be O(1).

parameters.doc: uint32_t index of the element to remove
parameters.name: index

returnvalues.doc: T& reference to the new element at index
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::EraseSwap

elements.description: Remove the element by reference The removed element is replaced by the element at the end (if any), thus potentially altering the order. While operation changes the array size, it is guaranteed to be O(1).

parameters.doc: T& reference to the element to remove.
parameters.name: element

returnvalues.doc: T& reference to the new referenced element
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::EraseSwapRef

elements.description: First element of the array

returnvalues.doc: T& reference to the first element
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::Front

elements.description: First element of the array (const)

returnvalues.doc: const T& const-reference to the first element
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::Front

elements.description: Check if the array is full. The array is full when the size is equal to the capacity.

returnvalues.doc: boolean true if the array is full
returnvalues.name: boolean

elements.name: dmArray::Full

elements.description: Relative change of capacity Equivalent to SetCapacity(Capacity() + offset). Only allowed for auto-allocated arrays and will result in a new dynamic allocation followed by memcpy of the elements.

parameters.doc: uint32_t relative amount of elements to change the capacity
parameters.name: offset

elements.name: dmArray::OffsetCapacity

elements.description: Remove the last element of the array Only allowed when the size is larger than zero.
elements.name: dmArray::Pop

elements.description: Add an element to the end of the array Only allowed when the capacity is larger than size.

parameters.doc: const T& element element to add
parameters.name: element

elements.name: dmArray::Push

elements.description: Add an array of elements to the end of the array Only allowed when the capacity is larger than size + count

parameters.doc: const T& array of elements to add
parameters.name: array

parameters.doc: uint32_t amount of elements in the array
parameters.name: count

elements.name: dmArray::PushArray

elements.description: Amount of additional elements that can be stored

returnvalues.doc: uint32_t amount of additional elements that can be stored
returnvalues.name: number

elements.name: dmArray::Remaining

elements.description: Set the capacity of the array. If the size is less than the capacity, the array is truncated. If it is larger, the array is extended. Only allowed for auto-allocated arrays and will result in a new dynamic allocation followed by memcpy of the elements.
elements.name: dmArray::SetCapacity

elements.description: Set size of the array

parameters.doc: uint32_t size of the array, must be less or equal to the capacity
parameters.name: size

elements.name: dmArray::SetSize

elements.description: Size of the array in elements
elements.name: dmArray::Size

elements.description: Swap the content of two arrays

parameters.doc: dmArray<T>& reference to array to swap content with
parameters.name: rhs

elements.name: dmArray::Swap

elements.examples: dmArray<int>* a = new dmArray<int>();
elements.name: dmArray::dmArray

elements.description: user-allocated array with initial size and capacity

parameters.doc: T* User-allocated array to be used as storage.
parameters.name: user_array

elements.name: dmArray::dmArray

elements.description: Retrieve an element by index

returnvalues.doc: T& reference to the element at the specified index
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::operator[]

elements.description: Retrieve an element by index (const)

returnvalues.doc: const T& const-reference to the element at the specified index
returnvalues.name: reference

elements.name: dmArray::operator[]

elements.description: Only frees memory when auto-allocated.
elements.name: dmArray::~dmArray
